newsitem.title: INDIA: India's United Front to meet on Monday afternoon.
newsitem.headline: India's United Front to meet on Monday afternoon.

text.p: Indian Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda's United Front coalition was scheduled to meet later on Monday to map strategy after the Congress party announced it was withdrawing its parliamentary support.
United Front spokesman Jaipal Reddy told Reuters the Steering Committee of the 15-party United Front coalition was set to meet at 3:30 p.m. (1000 GMT) at the prime minister's official residence.
A news conference was tentatively set for 5:30 p.m. (1200 GMT), Reddy said
On Sunday, Reddy said Deve Gowda would not resign after Congress president Sitaram Kesri announced his party was revoking support for the 10-month-old centre-left coalition.
The prime minister intended to face parliament when it reconvenes on April 21, he said.
